channel.title: IDE's
channel.description: Im actually using eclipse but i've heard that netbeans is easier to use, wich IDE do you use? would you recommend any?

item.title: IDE's
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Team_Rocket:

Eclipse is one of the best free Integrated Developmental Environments ever created. [b]FACT.

Itellij > *

I’m a recent Intellij to Netbeans converter. Intellij has better refactoring tools and just in general ‘feels’ less clunky.

Also, Sublime Text 2 master race.

Read full topic

item.title: IDE's
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Fire capez, post:3, topic:477614”][troll]
I use libreoffice writer because it allows me to make easy usage of colour coding.
[/troll]

[serious]
Eclipse, the only reason I can give you is I don’t have any money for Intellj idea ultimate which means that not only do I have a lack of support for external languages but Java development is limited (no spring, no hibernation), i’ve used Netbeans quite happily in the past and if I had to use it I wouldn’t be bothered at all it’s a perfectly adequate tool for most programming languages as is Eclipse.
[/serious][/quote]
The community edition is fine for most things, and offers a far superior experience to netbeans and eclipse, both of which are utter crap.

Read full topic

item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I use Eclipse, but mainly because it’s the one that I’m most comfortable with and it’s the only one that I have experience with so I’d rather stick with it.
